Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First let me understand the normative process 1 Always starts with Receive order 2 Next must be Check inventory before any payment authorization or fulfillment decisions 3 If inventory sufficient Authorize payment Package items Ship order Close order 4 If inventory insufficient Cancel order Close order Key constraints Authorize payment should only occur after Check inventory and before packaging Package items should only occur after authorization and before shipping Ship order should only occur after packaging and never after a cancellation Close order should be the final activity in all scenarios

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Package items Ship order Close order This follows the sufficient inventory path perfectly Receive Check correct Check Authorize correct Authorize Package correct Package Ship correct Ship Close correct No violations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Receive order Check inventory Package items Authorize payment Ship order Close order Package items occurs before Authorize payment Violates the rule that packaging should only occur after payment authorization Case 2 has a violation Packaging before payment authorization

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Cancel order Ship order Close order Started as sufficient inventory path but then canceled and shipped Shipping after cancellation explicitly forbidden Shipping without packaging also a violation Multiple violations Shipping after cancellation and shipping without packaging

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Receive order Check inventory Cancel order Close order Follows the insufficient inventory path Receive Check Cancel Close No violations here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Ship order Close order Missing Package items between Authorize and Ship Shipping without packaging is a violation Case 5 violates the process by skipping the packaging step

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Summary of violations Case 2 Packaging before payment authorization Case 3 Shipping after cancellation and shipping without packaging Case 5 Shipping without packaging skipping packaging step

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: Let me double-check if there are any other interpretations or ambiguities Ambiguities to consider 1 Is it possible to authorize payment even if inventory is insufficient Case 3 has both Authorize payment and Cancel order 2 Can Close order appear multiple times No 3 Timestamp order definitive Yes 4 Case 3 sequencing issue mixed path 5 Packaging before authorization not acceptable 6 Packaging absolutely mandatory So my analysis holds

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Structure of the answer State which cases violate Cases 2 3 and 5 Explain each violation in detail referencing the text For Case 2 Violation Incorrect sequencing packaging before payment authorization For Case 3 Violation 1 Shipping after cancellation Violation 2 Shipping without packaging For Case 5 Violation Skipping packaging step One final check Are there any other subtle violations In Case 3 Authorize before Cancel but main violation is Ship after Cancel Everything looks good
